The information below will be updated when the form comes out.

Kwararafa University Post-UTME Screening Form for 2021/2022 Academic Session is now on sale. The form cost N7,000. Kwararafa university cut off mark is 140.

This is to inform students and the general public that Kwararafa University Post-UTME Screening Form 2021/2022 is out.

Applications are hereby invited from suitably qualified candidates for admissions into the various undergraduate degree programmes of the Kwararafa University, Wukari (KUW) Taraba for the 2021/2022 academic session.

Page Contents

Kwararafa University Courses

Candidates Eligible to Apply for Kwararafa University Post UTME

How to Apply for Kwararafa University Post UTME

Kwararafa University Courses

COLLEGE OF MANAGEMENT AND SOCIAL SCIENCES

B.Sc Accounting,

B.Sc Economics,

B.Sc Business Administration,

Sc Political Science and International Relations,

B.Sc Public Administration,

B.Sc Sociology,

B.Sc Criminology and Security Studies,

B.Sc Mass Communication,

B.Sc Geography

COLLEGE OF NATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCE

B.Sc Biology,

B.Sc Computer Science

B.Sc Statistics,

COLLEGE OF EDUCATION

B.Ed Educational Management,

B.Ed Guidance and Counselling,

B.Ed Human Kinetics and Health Education.

Admissions into Kwararafa University, Wukari is open to all, irrespective of race, tribe, religion, sex or political leanings. Prospective students must satisfy all College and Departmental requirements in addition to the following general requirements:

A. UTME

For admission to 100 level, candidates must possess five (5) credit passes at Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination (SSSCE), GCE, NECO or equivalent in relevant subjects in not more than two sittings; and obtain a score of 140 and above in the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination.

University shall insist on possession of credit passes in English Language and Mathematics for all categories of students.

The University shall also conduct post JAMB screening to ensure that only the best students are admitted. In addition to the general admission requirements stated above, a candidate must meet specific departmental requirements

B. DIRECT ENTRY (DE)

For admission to 200 level, candidates must possess five (5) passes at credit level (including English Language) at Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination (SSSCE), GCE, NECO or equivalent in relevant subjects in not more than two sittings.

In addition to the above, candidates should have at least two advanced level passes in the General Certificate of Education examination in relevant subjects, or

Ordinary National Diploma with credit level or Nigeria Certificate of Education (NCE) with Credit level.

Passes in two IJMB/JUPEB courses out of the three

Forms are obtained for the sum of N7,000 seven thousand naira only payable to Kwararafa University Zenith Bank account number 10112472423 and the bank teller presented to the university bursary for issue of application forms.

For more information, you can call 08109789030,08125104970.

Thank you so much for reading. We will appreciate it if you share this with your loved ones.
